issue.title: Add label description as part of the taxonomy

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: Triage needed from PM team (Or Engineering team if to technical)

issue.body:
## Use case

labels act as a taxonomy which is excellent. At the moment it is not possible to describe this label or taxonomy in detail though.

## Current Workaround

documentation outside of platform 

## Proposed Solution

a possibility to further describe what the purpose of a label is in the platform so that analysts can refer back to the label and understand what the purpose is

issue.title: Playbooks don't work correctly
issue.body:
## Description

"Listen knowledge events" does not work.

## Environment

1. OS: Ubuntu 20.04.6
2. OpenCTI version: OpenCTI 5.11.11
3. OpenCTI client: frontend

## Reproducible Steps

1. Create playbook with filters: 
- Observable type: Url
- Entity type: Observable
2. Enable the "Creation events" and "Modification events" checkboxes  (*screenshot 1*)
3. And for example add "Send user notification"  (*screenshot 2*) with:
- Notifiers: User interface
- Targets: Default
4. Start the playbook
5. Create an observable Url and modify it  (*screenshot 4*)
6. Look that nothing appeared in "Last execution traces"  (*screenshot 5*)

## Expected Output

Executed playbooks are displayed in "Last execution traces".

## Actual Output

Executed playbooks are not displayed in "Last execution traces".

## Screenshots (optional)

![image_2023-10-27_09-58-19](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/122795003/21462663-a534-40aa-9ac8-c517f903cf7a)

![image_2023-10-27_10-17-54](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/122795003/9c40ee88-9c9c-436c-96a1-191ea2e28b44)

![image_2023-10-27_10-00-10](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/122795003/ba180e63-84b5-4e1a-9db0-b5a74f44e33e)

![image_2023-10-27_10-23-13](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/122795003/4d6c7c13-ed66-4261-b6fb-f89b4997f46e)

![image_2023-10-27_10-27-18](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/122795003/6bccb323-6cb5-4f36-8997-7c6b20eef9a2)

comment.body: When I run the enrichment myself, everything works fine. The error only occurs when running enrichment via Playbook. Other internal enrichment connectors also cause errors when run through Playbook.

issue.title: OIDC SSO not working in cluster mode

labels.name: needs more info
labels.description: Intel needed about the use case

issue.body:
## Description

OIDC SSO login fails if OpenCTI is deployed in cluster mode:
`{"category":"APP","error":"did not find expected authorization request details in session, req.session[\"oidc:cognito-idp.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com\"] is undefined","level":"error","message":"Error login through provider oic","timestamp":"2023-10-04T10:47:48.752Z","version":"5.10.3"}`

## Environment

1. OS: Kubernetes 1.26 on ubuntu 22.04
2. OpenCTI version: 5.10.3
3. OpenCTI client: frontend
4. Other environment details: OIDC configuration:
```
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__STRATEGY: OpenIDConnectStrategy
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__LABEL: "Login with AWS"
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__ISSUER: "https://cognito-idp.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com/eu-north-1_XXXXXXXX"
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__REDIRECT_URIS: "[\"https://opencti.XXXXXXX.XXX/auth/oic/callback\"]"
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__GROUPS_MANAGEMENT__GROUPS_PATH: "[\"cognito:groups\"]"
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__GROUPS_MANAGEMENT__GROUPS_MAPPING: "[\"c367380755-eba4eff3-5787-41cf-8a70-e59a336c7ec8:Admins\", \"c367380755-97a0549d-58fb-4a4f-a7ac-9db930bdcbaa:Admins\"]"
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__CLIENT_ID: XXXXXXXX
  PROVIDERS__OPENID__CONFIG__CLIENT_SECRET: XXXXXXX
```

## Reproducible Steps

Steps to create the smallest reproducible scenario:
1. deploy OpenCTI through HELM
2. configure OIDC as a SSO method
3. OIDC sso is working
4. increase replicas to 2+
5. OIDC sso is not consistently working

## Expected Output

Clicking on the OIDC login button is redirecting me to my IDP for authentication and then on the OpenCTI default dashboard

## Actual Output

Clicking on the OIDC login button is redirecting me to my IDP for authentication and then back on the login page with an error `Invalid authentication, please ask your administrator`

## Additional information

## Screenshots (optional)
![Screenshot 2023-10-04 at 13 00 42](https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/assets/35832688/7fea78d5-b977-4b6e-90e2-27a6dfabc8b4)

comment.body:
Hey all, thank you for being that proactive.
I tested after upgrading and setting `APP__HTTPS_CERT__COOKIE_SECURE=true`. 
The errors are gone and I can more or less confidently log in into OpenCTI but, from time to time, clicking the oidc button redirects me to the login page again and a subsequent press of let me log in without showing the IDP panel

pull_request.title: Align search panel in Investigation with others in the platform (#issue/4455)
pull_request.body:
The search panel in Investigation graph (when you want to add an entity to the graph) is the legacy one. We must replace it with the new one that can be found in Knowledge graph.

### Proposed changes

* Replace the search panel in investigration graph

### Related issues

* https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/issues/4455

### Checklist

<!--
Please submit the source code in a way, where you could honestly say `This code is finished`.
If you feel that there are possibilities for improving the code quality, please do so.
By doing this, you are actively helping us to improve the quality of the entire OpenCTI project.
-->

- [x] I consider the submitted work as finished
- [x] I tested the code for its functionality
- [ ] I wrote test cases for the relevant uses case
- [ ] I added/update the relevant documentation (either on github or on notion)
- [ ] Where necessary I refactored code to improve the overall quality

<!-- _NOTE: these things are not required to open a PR and can be done afterwards / while the PR draft is open._ -->
<!-- For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

issue.title: Sources for observables

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: Triage needed from PM team (Or Engineering team if to technical)

issue.body:
## Use case
We'd like to categorize the origin of an observable and event. We gather observables and events from multiple sources like commercial ti streams, open ti streams, web crawling, deep and dark web crawling, social media, ...
Therefore it would be very beneficial to somehow store the source of the entity.

## Current Workaround
A combination of author and labels. E.g. Author Dark Web Crawler, Label source:russianmarket.

## Proposed Solution
Allow to add sources to entities. The source should be a separate entity type (or role, like described in #4757).

## Additional context
The current solution of "voting" for reliability only works at small scale because if you have e.g. 100k ingestions / day no company is capable to analyze this with personnel efforts. Therefore a pre categorization of the sources could help to further analyze the entities with AI and then only give the rest that have to be verified to the real analysts.  

## If the feature request is approved, would you be willing to submit a PR?
Yes

issue.title: MINIO__USE_AWS_ROLE does not work for AWS EKS hosted OpenCTI
issue.body:
## Description

Setting MINIO__USE_AWS_ROLE environment variable to true causes platform pod to fail starting, throwing a "could not load credentials from any providers"

## Environment

1. OS (where OpenCTI server runs): AWS EKS
2. OpenCTI version: 5.11.11
3. OpenCTI client: frontend
4. Other environment details:

## Reproducible Steps

Steps to create the smallest reproducible scenario:
1. Deploy OpenCTI to an AWS EKS cluster, having set MINIO__USE_AWS_ROLE to true
2. Check logs for platform container - this returns error "could not load credentials from any providers"


## Expected Output

Platform should launch correctly, having assumed credentials from the attached ServiceAccount role, and should be able to upload files to S3

## Actual Output

Platform fails to start, throwing error "could not load credentials from any providers"

## Additional information

I have confirmed my ServiceAccount is correctly attached to the pod that the platform container is running on and has the correct permissions. I have checked file-storage.js ( /src/database/ ) and it appears that it uses `remoteProvider` from the AWS SDK. This should be changed to `defaultProvider` as the former is referenced in the latter and should not break functionality for workloads hosted in ECS and EC2. Workloads that require AWS credentials gain this via an attached ServiceAccount, and a token file is mounted to the pod. I have tested changing to `defaultProvider` and have had success, therefore I can confirm that this should be the fix adopted for this issue. See below link for context on defaultProvider

https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-js-v3/blob/ba83d46690522a0a18094d7cd72d95724c95177b/packages/credential-provider-node/src/defaultProvider.ts

## Screenshots (optional)

pull_request.title: [backend] Improve locking and add abort controller

issue.title: Failed TAXII Ingester ingestion (CISA AIS 2.0)

comment.body:
For people reading this, TAXII 2.1 specification is clear about this parameter must be a string and not a number.
We have setup a workaround to force it as a string to support wrong api implementation

issue.title: OpenCTI as an observable caching proxy

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: Triage needed from PM team (Or Engineering team if to technical)

issue.body:
## Use case

I don't want to have tens and tens of millions of observables on my instance by downloading tons of CTI feeds from CTI providers. So, in some condition, I would like that OpenCTI works just like a "caching proxy" for observables and keep track of which observables have been searched.

<!-- Please describe the use case for which you need a solution -->

## Current Workaround

Implement the logic on the client side.

## Proposed Solution

Create an api endpoint with an option to ask for context enrichment and observable creation (waiting by blocking or polling..)

Quick and dirty diagram:

```mermaid

sequenceDiagram
    Client->>OpenCTI: Get context about 1.2.3.4, enrich=True
    OpenCTI-->>Client: No context about 1.2.3.4, get context started id=X, come back later

    loop Every X seconds
        Client->>OpenCTI:Get context about 1.2.3.4,  enrich=True, id=X
        OpenCTI->>Client:get context not finished, come back later
    end


    par OpenCTI to CTI provider A
        OpenCTI->>CTI provider A: Get context about 1.2.3.4
        CTI provider A->>OpenCTI: context about 1.2.3.4
    and OpenCTI to CTI provider B
        OpenCTI->>CTI provider B: Get context about 1.2.3.4
        CTI provider A->>OpenCTI: None
    and OpenCTI to CTI provider C
        OpenCTI->>CTI provider B: Get context about 1.2.3.4
        CTI provider C->>OpenCTI: context about 1.2.3.4
    end
    Note over OpenCTI:  observable created
    Client->>OpenCTI:Get context about 1.2.3.4,  enrich=True, id=X
    OpenCTI->>Client:get context finished, here is the context about 1.2.3.4


```

## Additional Information

The client could be another OpenCTI instance.


## If the feature request is approved, would you be willing to submit a PR?

No
